intro: Pentacalia scytophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence, and it produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
